back_cards.example_en: The number of students in the class increased.
She wrote her phone number on the napkin.
He finished as number one in the race.

back_cards.definition_en: A song or piece in a performance.
back_cards.example_en: The band played their hit number last.
A number of birds gathered by the lake.
She loves to write stories in her journal.
He wrote the meeting notes on his laptop.
They write to each other every week.

back_cards.definition_en: To author a book or article.
back_cards.example_en: She wrote a guide about hiking trails.
The kids wrote their names on the board.

back_cards.definition_en: To carry or take something to a place.
back_cards.example_en: Please bring your homework to class tomorrow.
The rain will bring relief to the dry crops.
She brought a new idea to the meeting.
The festival brings tourists to the town.
He brought his friend to the party.
She left the house without her keys.
He climbed the hill without any help.
The dog stayed without the fence.
They survived without food for two days.
She traveled without her usual backpack.
He saved money for a new bike.
The company invested a lot of money in research.
She earned money by tutoring kids.
They raised money for the local shelter.
He paid for the coffee with pocket money.
She has a lot of books in her room.
They bought a lot to build their house.

back_cards.definition_en: A group of items sold together.
back_cards.example_en: He won a lot of old coins at the auction.
The car was parked in the grocery store lot.
They drew lots to decide the winner.
She enjoyed the hiking trip most of all.
Most people prefer coffee over tea.
This is the most beautiful park I’ve seen.
He was most helpful during the project.
Most of the team attended the meeting.
She read a mystery book last weekend.

back_cards.definition_en: A collection of pages bound together.
back_cards.example_en: A record or ledger.
He checked the company’s financial book.

back_cards.definition_en: A set of tickets or reservations.
back_cards.example_en: They purchased a book of train tickets.

back_cards.definition_en: A division of a larger work.
back_cards.example_en: The novel is the first book in a series.

back_cards.definition_en: A set of things working together.
back_cards.example_en: The solar system includes eight planets.
She developed a system to stay organized.
A network of structures or channels.
The city upgraded its water system.
Stress can weaken the immune system.
The new system crashed during the test.

back_cards.definition_en: The ruling authority of a country.
back_cards.example_en: The government passed a law on recycling.
They studied the government in history class.
The government met to discuss the budget.
Local government handles road repairs.
Good government ensures public safety.
The next bus arrives in ten minutes.
She sat at the next table in the café.
The next chapter is about space travel.
They’re getting married next summer.
The store is in the next town over.
She moved to the city for work.
The city council approved the new bridge.
The city was alive with lights at night.
This city is known for its music scene.
Tourists love the city’s historic sites.
She works for a tech company.
They enjoyed the company of friends at dinner.
We’re expecting company for the holidays.
The captain led his company into battle.
The dance company performed on stage.
He told a spooky story by the campfire.
The news covered the story of the storm.

back_cards.definition_en: A plot in a book or film.
back_cards.example_en: The movie has a gripping love story.
She shared her story of moving abroad.
Their office is on the tenth story.
Today is perfect for a walk in the park.

back_cards.definition_en: In the present time or era.
back_cards.example_en: Today, people rely heavily on technology.

back_cards.definition_en: The team meets today to plan.

back_cards.example_en: Today’s youth are passionate about climate.
Today marks the festival’s opening.
He found a job at the factory.

back_cards.definition_en: A task or piece of work.
back_cards.example_en: Fixing the roof was a big job.
It’s her job to feed the dog.
The design job took three weeks.

back_cards.definition_en: A slang term for something done well.
back_cards.example_en: You did a great job on the report!
She moved the chair to the corner.

back_cards.definition_en: To relocate to a new place.
back_cards.example_en: They moved to a bigger apartment.
The project is finally moving forward.
His speech moved the audience.
She moved to adjourn the meeting.
You must wear a helmet while biking.
It must be cold outside; it’s snowing.
You must try the local pizza here.
We must finish this report by tomorrow.
This museum is a must for tourists.
The food at that café was bad.
She had a bad cold last week.
The villain made bad choices in the story.
The storm caused bad damage to the town.
He’s bad at playing chess.

back_cards.definition_en: A person you know and like.
back_cards.example_en: She met a new friend at the book club.
He’s been a friend to the arts community.
They’ve been friends since childhood.

back_cards.definition_en: A person in a social network.
back_cards.example_en: She added a friend on social media.
A friend recommended this hiking trail.

back_cards.definition_en: Throughout the time of an event.
back_cards.example_en: She read a book during the flight.

back_cards.definition_en: At some point in a period.
back_cards.example_en: He called during the lunch break.
They hiked during the summer vacation.

back_cards.definition_en: In the course of an activity.
back_cards.example_en: Mistakes happened during the rehearsal.
The town was quiet during the festival.
She began the meeting with a welcome.
The rain began to fall at noon.
He began his career as a teacher.
She began by explaining the rules.
The river begins in the mountains.

back_cards.definition_en: A deep feeling of or affection.
back_cards.example_en: Their love grew stronger over the years.
She has a love for painting landscapes.
A term of endearment.
He called his daughter his little love.
Their love story was like a fairy tale.
I love have a love for chocolate cream.

back_cards.definition_en: Every one of two or more items.
back_cards.example_en: Each student received a certificate.
Each flower in the garden is unique.
They checked each item on the list.
Each team member contributed an idea.
She gave each child a piece of candy.
He held the baby gently in his arms.

back_cards.definition_en: To keep in place or control.
back_cards.example_en: She held her temper during the argument.
The jar holds 500 coins.
The team holds first place in the league.
They held a meeting in the town hall.

back_cards.definition_en: Not the same as something else.
back_cards.example_en: Her style is different from everyone else’s.
The museum has different exhibits each month.
He took a different route to work today.
They come from different backgrounds.
This coffee tastes different from the usual.
American football is popular at school.
She loves American jazz music.
They served American-style burgers.
The American team won the tournament.
Her accent is distinctly American.
A little bird landed on the windowsill.
The little boy ran to the playground.
She added a little sugar to her tea.
He felt a little pain after the fall.
What a little puppy you have!
She arrived before the meeting started.
He stood before the judge in court.
They ate a snack before the movie.
Check the map before you hike.
Her name comes before his in the list.
Have you ever been to the mountains?
She’s the best friend I’ve ever had.
What’s the worst that could ever happen?
This is the quietest it’s ever been.
I’ve never seen anything like it.
